import React from 'react' import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag' import GlobalStyle from '../../src/Utils/GlobalStyle.js' import Scale from './SpacingScale.js' const layoutProps = { }; export default class MDXContent extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.layout = null } render() { const { components, ...props } = this.props return {`Spacing Scale`} {`import theme from '../src/Utils/Theme'`}{` or `}{`import { spacing } from '../src/Utils/Theme'`} {`Introduction`} {`Every part of a UI should be intentional including the empty space between elements. The amount of space between items creates relationships and hierarchy.`} {`Use the spacing scale when building individual components. It includes small increments needed to create appropriate spatial relationships for detail-level designs. This scale is applied and used within all components.`} {`More on constraint layout (for designers) on `}{`Medium`}{`.`} {`Usage`} {`Used for smaller, more refined spacing needs, specifically within the context of a component (i.e. the space between a label and a text input). Can be use on padding, margin, height, width or anything.`} {`padding: \${theme.spacing[5]};`}{` `}
{`height: \${theme.spacing[4]};`}{` `}
{`width: \${theme.spacing[8]};`} {`Tokens`} } }
